amendment.description: An amendment numbered 3 printed in Part H of House Report 116-438 to increase funding for comprehensive lead service line replacement program by $4.44 billion and require the administrator to give priority to eligible entities serving disadvantaged communities.
amendment.purpose: Amendment increases funding for comprehensive lead service line replacement program by $4.44 billion and requires the administrator to give priority to eligible entities serving disadvantaged communities.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Tlaib amendment (A010) Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 240 - 181 (Roll no. 136).

action.text: The previous question was ordered on the amendment (A010) pursuant to the rule.
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A010) offered by Ms. Tlaib.
Amendment agreed to by House: On agreeing to the Tlaib amendment (A010) Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 240 - 181 (Roll no. 136).
